H0.text: No lungs are why fish have short esophaguses.

H1.text: Big tail is why fish have short esophaguses.

H2.text: No intestines are the reason fish have short esophaguses.

H3.text: No mouths are the reason fish have short esophaguses.

A4.text: In most fish, the esophagus is extremely short, primarily due to the length of the pharynx (which is associated with the gills).

A5.text: Some fish, including lampreys, chimaeras, and lungfish, have no true stomach, so that the esophagus effectively runs from the pharynx directly to the intestine, and is therefore somewhat longer.
